review_title: Still works with my fair skin!
review_content:
This is a great palette. I think natasha denona is more known for her eyeshadows which are great but she also does cheek palettes very well. I have very fair skin and this still works for me. The deeper shade I need just a dab for my whole cheeks. I usually prefer using the cream base and then the bottom right highlighter for blush on my skin type. If you have medium or deep skin you will love this palette.

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette

review_content:
I have to admit that I was initially intimidated by this palette. I am VERY fair, and this palette works for me! I use the tiniest amount of the cream blush, and it’s beautiful. It blends nicely. A little goes a long way. I can see it working for all skin tones because this cream blush is extremely pigmented. The two powders compliment the blush beautifully. It adds a peachy vibe. This is now the blush I use every day. I didn’t know blush could be like this! I have already ordered the other blush palette - the Love Palette. I can’t wait to try it!

One of those products I’ve looked at but never pulled the trigger bc “I have so many blushes already“...finally gave it a shot and so glad I did. It’s such a great color on my fair skin. It represents Nars Orgasm blush which doubles as a highlighter. It is Fenty Beauty Yacht Life and Trippin. It is Gurlain Four Seasons in 07 Ebony which I have purchased three times and no longer have. Yet, it is so much more. Sheer Perfection. Unrivalled in its pigmentation, reflectivity, and even the colors themselves. All of my dreams practically packaged in one timeless pallet. For once, the hype was real. Truly a gem in the industry.

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I've been using this palette for a few months now, and I'm utterly in love! Having the two creams separated by an additional cover protects them from getting caked in flyaway glitter; genuinely one of the best packaging designs I've had on a makeup product. The two cream bases are very true to the color in the pan. They can be applied sheerly for lighter color and blend out very well, and they have great build-up. The powder blush has a lovely peachy shimmer to it, and it looks SO beautiful over the lighter cream base! The highlight has some serious sheen to it, though make sure to tap off your brush since there's a bit of fallout. The absolute best BEST part about this palette though is that you can use it for a full look! The nice range of color/textures let's you use it for eyeshadow and blush, and it makes for an amazing travel palette. I'm obsessed with eye makeup, so to be able to travel with just the one palette and still get a cohesive eye-face look is amazing! Depending on how much you build up the darker cream blush on your lids, you can rock a look that just flirts with a splash of color, or do an intense pop for a night out! Pat on a little bit of the cream blush on your lips too, and you're golden! On a scale of 1 to even I just can't with this palette

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Natasha Denona has the ability to understand what looks good on a women of varying complexions, and she's created a palette that is both unique to the market and incredibly versatile! I got this palette six months ago, and I was initially drawn in by the coral packaging. Four powders in one by a brand I love? Lots of good reviews on the Sephora site? Done. That was enough to convince me, but now after this a bit, I am glad I trusted the rave reviews. I especially appreciate the variety of formulas- four different kinds, each beautiful in its own way. My personal favorite is the duo glow in vibrant, golden coral. It makes an excellent blush or blush topper, depending upon your skin tone... and the same is true for every shade. I've seen very fair ladies use the Fuschia cream blush with a light hand, and I've seen deeper-complected ladies use the nude champagne shade as a cheek or brow bone highlight. But is it worth the $55? If you're on the fence, I'd say get it.. it's sturdy, has a magnetic clasp, efficient, and you'd get a lot of use out of it. Is it a must have? No. Makeup never is! Save that money if you'd prefer. I'm more proud of my credit score than my makeup collection :D

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: incredibly versatile palette, easy to use
review_content:
I rarely invest in palettes because I usually end up using 1-2 shades I really like, and this is especially true for highlighter/blush palettes. That said I saw this palette featured in Allure and the shades were so beautiful I had to check it out. I'm not a makeup pro by any means, and I found it incredibly easy to use. The deepest shade is what drew me to the palette and it's as close as I've seen to a blush that looks like a natural flush worn on its own. A little goes a LONG way, which is a bonus because it should last a long time! It can also be used as a matte lip stain that's very comparable to Urban Decay Lo-Fi Lip Mousse. The peach powder can be layered over for a more glam/glowy look. The cream highlight gives a natural glow even on very fair skin, and the powder highlight is great for accenting the inner corners of the eyes and brow bones. This is an outstanding cruelty-free, travel-friendly palette that I'll use every day.

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: Soft and subtle or a punch in the face..
review_content:
This face palette is absolutely stunning. I use every single pan in here to create amazing looks. Normally, us oily skin girls have to avoid cream products -- not with the Bloom B&G! I layer all of the products like she does in the video (I highly recommend watching her tutorials), and I get loads of compliments on my smooth complexion and highlight. The blush has INSANE pigment, so I tap into it very gently with my BB, and press/sweep it onto my skin. The color is universally flattering, and makes for a beautiful pale pink to light berry cheek. But girl/guy.. this highlight though. My Lord. Its intense in a subtle way.. it's not one of those, "look at this blinding streak of shiney stuff on my face." It's more the, "oh, what a soft and pretty highlight" and then the right light hits it and it punches you in the face. Get it. Punch people in the face. You know you want to.

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I really wanted to like this palette but it didn't work for me. I have extremely pale skin and the pigmentation of this was too intense for me. I was looking for an everyday blush palette, however, this was very dramatic and probably better for a going out at night look. The cream blushes are pretty difficult to work with as well if you aren't comfortable with a cream blush.

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette

review_content: This is so pretty! I love using this palette for a monochromatic look on the cheeks, eyes and lips. They are just so pretty! Blends easily, layers well and are versatile. Try this, you won’t regret it!

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I love this palette so much! I use the two cream shades for a more natural look, and layer all four when I'm feeling like I want a more glam (but still office appropriate) look. Sometimes I think the highlighter shade is a wee bit too glittery, but I just buff in another, glitter-free highlighter over it to tone it down a notch. I was worried the blush colour would be too dark for my very fair skin, but as long as I use a light hand, it imparts a really nice, natural flush of colour. I've used this every day since I got it, and I find myself really disliking the look of my powder blushes now. I really, really hope these come out in more colour varieties soon!

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Dark', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: Amazing Formula and Glow but Not long lasting
review_content:
I have dark skin.. Fenty 420(too red), Nars Macao(too light during summer), Lancôme 500. I would definitely get this palette . It’s soooo gorgeous on the skin even with my acne and texture. I would give this 5 stars because the colors and texture are BEAUTIFUL!! The cream blush can apply over set skin without lifting(only apply with synthetic brush, no wet sponges) . I don’t even like pink blush but it blends ought to a beautiful flush. The highlight and glow this palette gives the cheeks and forehead is BEAUTIFUL!!!!!!! I try to put it all over my face .. as much as I can. It makes my makeup look good BUTTT IT DOESN’T LAST!!! The blush’s fades too quickly. If you going out for a long day, the blush color doesn’t hold up. For you to have a cream blush and set it, you would think it would last but not this!! The color blush and highlight fade too quickly. 4 hours and it’s 50% gone. Do I regret this palette ... NOOO . But it’s such a disappointment that’s for $55 the blush coke fades too quickly . The cremes and color lay on textured skin so well( and it just gives your cheeks a sweaty, glowy look. I will say that after the blush fades, it doesn’t move or separate foundation. The formula works with all of my foundations. It acts as though it melts in with each foundation. It doesn’t take away any coverage or separate

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I had great hopes for this little palette. Being my first Natasha Denona product I was determined to make it work, the packaging is beautiful and so convenient as the cream products have a little glass separating it. As for the product it self, the top shades are cream, the right side (darker shade) is truly beautiful, except you have to go in with a very light hand. It is PIGMENTED! the top left shade(lighter cream) not much to it, didn’t see much of a color. The bottom shades which are highlighter/toppers, basically glitter chunks. I was heavily disappointed on this product so much that I returned it. Three stars because I did actually like the top right darker shade as a blush, but other than that it is not worth the price.

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I love the cream products in this palette. The deeper pink is beautiful and very easy to blend. The lighter pink does not show up very well on my skin, but is a good base for other blushes or highlights. I don’t find myself using the highlights too often in this palette, because they are a little too glittery for my preference. If I could buy just the dark pink cream in this palette, I would because it is so worth it.

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Love this product. It is a must get if you like to layer blush/highlight products but can’t because you have large pores or textured skin.

product_name: Natasha Denona Bloom Blush & Glow Palette
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This gives me a natural blush look and I love it! The highlights? POPPIN! But DO NOT use a heavy hand with the cream blush. Even if you tap your blender in it the slightest bit, make sure you still tap some off on the back of your hand because it is PIGMENTED. And if you do put on too much, DO NOT use your beauty blender in hopes it’ll soak up some product because it will just spread even more. (At least i know it’s blendable and stays true in color though). But if you cannot help in being heavy handed, I would suggest applying the blush before foundation. It will still give you a nice flush of color.
